paragraph.paragraph: The DESC mechanism enables you to construct objects representing external routines determined at execution time through their name and libraries, and call these routines with the appropriate arguments.
paragraph.note: NOTE: The libraries containing the routines determined at runtime are unmanaged (non-.NET) libraries. .NET libraries (also known as assemblies) can be accessed directly using project references.
paragraph.paragraph:
Two classes,
../../reference/desc/spec/win32/dll_32_chart.xml DLL_32 and
../../reference/desc/spec/win32/dll_32_routine_chart.xml DLL_32_ROUTINE , supported by an auxiliary class
../../reference/desc/general/shared_library_constants_chart.xml SHARED_LIBRARY_CONSTANTS provide the basis for DESC under Windows:

list.item:
An instance of class
../../reference/desc/spec/win32/dll_32_chart.xml DLL_32 describes a 32-bit Dynamically Linked Library. This class is a descendant of the deferred class
../../reference/desc/general/shared_library_chart.xml SHARED_LIBRARY , covering the platform-independent notion of shared library.

An instance of class
../../reference/desc/spec/win32/dll_32_routine_chart.xml DLL_32_ROUTINE describes a routine from a 32-bit DLL. Predictably, this class has an attribute of type
../../reference/desc/spec/win32/dll_32_chart.xml DLL_32 describing the library to which the routine belongs. It has a deferred ancestor
../../reference/desc/general/shared_library_routine_chart.xml SHARED_LIBRARY_ROUTINE capturing the platform-independent notion of shared library routine.

../../reference/desc/general/shared_library_constants_chart.xml SHARED_LIBRARY_CONSTANTS introduces a few declarations useful for dealing with shared libraries and routines, in particular a few integer constants describing error codes and type codes. It is an ancestor to both of the preceding classes; application classes using DESC can also inherit from it to gain access to its facilities.

paragraph.paragraph: The basic sequence of instructions to use the DESC mechanism is the following:

list.item:
library.xml Create a library object (an instance of
../../reference/desc/spec/win32/dll_32_chart.xml DLL_32 ) , providing the library's name as argument to the creation procedure.

routine.xml Create a routine object (an instance of
../../reference/desc/spec/win32/dll_32_routine_chart.xml DLL_32_ROUTINE ), providing the library object, the routine's name or index in the library, and the routine's signature - number of arguments, types of arguments, type of result if any - as arguments to the creation procedure.

routine_call.xml Apply procedure
../../reference/desc/spec/win32/dll_32_routine.xml#f_call call to the routine object, passing an array that contains the actual arguments required by the external routine.

paragraph.paragraph: Each of these steps may be repeated as often as necessary to use multiple libraries, multiple routines in a library, or multiple calls to a given routine.
